articles.headline: At SoftBank’s Jewel in India: ‘Toxic’ Culture and Troubling Incidents
articles.snippet: Oyo aims to be the world’s biggest hotel chain. But its growth was fueled by questionable practices, employees said.
articles.abstract: Oyo aims to be the world’s biggest hotel chain. But its growth was fueled by questionable practices, employees said.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Oyo, a start-up that offers budget hotel rooms, has grown into one of India’s most valuable private companies and aims to be the world’s largest hotel chain by 2023.
articles.byline: By Vindu Goel and Karan Deep Singh

articles.headline: Apple Deal Returns Former HBO Boss Richard Plepler to Spotlight
articles.snippet: Ten months after he chafed under AT&T’s takeover of the network, he reboots himself as a producer in a five-year deal with Apple TV Plus.
articles.abstract: Ten months after he chafed under AT&T’s takeover of the network, he reboots himself as a producer in a five-year deal with Apple TV Plus.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the 10 months since Richard Plepler stepped down as HBO’s chief executive, the final season of “Game of Thrones” came and went, CBS and Viacom merged, and Disney and Apple rolled out new streaming services.

articles.headline: Carlos Ghosn Flirted With Hollywood, Then Delivered a Plot Twist
articles.snippet: The fallen auto titan held early discussions with a movie producer before his audacious escape. The film’s villain: Japanese justice.
articles.abstract: The fallen auto titan held early discussions with a movie producer before his audacious escape. The film’s villain: Japanese justice.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Carlos Ghosn, the fallen head of the Nissan-Renault auto alliance, didn’t know much about making movies, but he seemed willing to learn.

articles.headline: Cash-Rich Democrats Brace for Long Fight as Trump Hoards Money
articles.snippet: Fund-raising numbers for the fourth quarter of 2019 show an unusually high number of viable campaigns. Waiting for the winner: President Trump and his huge war chest.
articles.abstract: Fund-raising numbers for the fourth quarter of 2019 show an unusually high number of viable campaigns. Waiting for the winner: President Trump and his huge war chest.
articles.lead_paragraph: A flood of money rushed into the presidential race in the last three months of 2019, producing an unusually large number of Democratic candidates with the resources to battle deep into the 2020 primary calendar, all vying for the right to face an incumbent president boasting his own enormous war chest.
articles.byline: By Shane Goldmacher and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: U.S. Strike in Iraq Kills Qassim Suleimani, Commander of Iranian Forces
articles.snippet: Suleimani was planning attacks on Americans across the region, leading to an airstrike in Baghdad, the Pentagon statement said. Iran’s supreme leader called for vengeance.
articles.abstract: Suleimani was planning attacks on Americans across the region, leading to an airstrike in Baghdad, the Pentagon statement said. Iran’s supreme leader called for vengeance.
articles.lead_paragraph: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. — Iran’s top security and intelligence commander was killed early Friday in a drone strike at Baghdad International Airport that was authorized by President Trump, American officials said.
articles.byline: By Michael Crowley, Falih Hassan and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: He Mocks Saudi Arabia on YouTube. Yes, He Fears for His Safety.
articles.snippet: Ghanem al-Masarir, a satirist based in London, says officials in Saudi Arabia are behind threats to his life and the spyware infection of his phones.
articles.abstract: Ghanem al-Masarir, a satirist based in London, says officials in Saudi Arabia are behind threats to his life and the spyware infection of his phones.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — No one has skewered the Saudi royal family as gleefully as Ghanem al-Masarir.

articles.headline: Hong Kong Considers the Future: ‘If You Can Afford It, Leave’
articles.snippet: As violence escalates and the Chinese government exerts greater control over the financial hub, residents wrestle with their options.
articles.abstract: As violence escalates and the Chinese government exerts greater control over the financial hub, residents wrestle with their options.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Everywhere Ivan Lam looks, he sees his possible future.

articles.headline: Pete Buttigieg and the One Percent
articles.snippet: Are the wealthy a liability in 2020? Or will they help get him elected?
articles.abstract: Are the wealthy a liability in 2020? Or will they help get him elected?
articles.lead_paragraph: At an annual charity fund-raiser in October, Anna Wintour, the editor of Vogue, shared a table with the designer Michael Kors and Pete Buttigieg, then the mayor of South Bend, Ind., who wore one of his trademark navy suits.

articles.headline: For Trump, a Risky Decision on Suleimani Is One Other Presidents Had Avoided
articles.snippet: In ordering the drone strike that killed Iran’s top security commander, Mr. Trump challenged predictions it could lead to a wider war in the Middle East.
articles.abstract: In ordering the drone strike that killed Iran’s top security commander, Mr. Trump challenged predictions it could lead to a wider war in the Middle East.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump was deep in discussion with political advisers going over campaign plans at his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida just before 5 p.m. Thursday when he was abruptly summoned to another meeting. A while later, he returned just as mysteriously, jumping back into the conversation without offering a clue to what was going on.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt, Helene Cooper, Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Maggie Haberman and Peter Baker
